title: Why are special characters used? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Special characters” may mean those that you don’t understand. The world’s languages (over 6000!) use many different writing systems. To a person who writes only in Japanese characters, the ABCs are “special characters.” And there are many characters that are punctuation (which also depends on the languages, e.g., quote marks in French), digits, and many others. The Unicode standard currently has over 140K characters in many different writing systems, covering almost all of the world’s currently written languages. The Unicode Standard home page will tell you more.
